metadata.Title: CVE-2022-28287 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In unusual circumstances, selecting text could cause text selection caching to behave incorrectly, leading to a crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 99.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-28287` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 99.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
firefox-geckodriver - 99.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 99.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '99.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.2').
